address: Xã Hà Lâm, Huyện Đạ Huoai, Tỉnh Lâm Đồng
thought:
**Address Mapping Analysis: From Old to New Vietnamese Administrative Units**

Okay, so I have a Vietnamese address here, "Xã Hà Lâm, Huyện Đạ Huoai, Tỉnh Lâm Đồng," and I need to figure out its new administrative equivalent. First things first, I break it down: "Xã Hà Lâm" is the old ward, "Huyện Đạ Huoai" the old district (which is useful context but ultimately eliminated), and "Tỉnh Lâm Đồng" the old province.

Now, I start with the province.  I quickly cross-reference that against resolution 60-NQ/TW to make sure there weren't any radical mergers or splits.  Thankfully, Lâm Đồng is still Lâm Đồng, no changes there.

Next, I need to dive into the specifics of ward-level re-organization within Lâm Đồng. I skip any unrelated resolutions and home in on 1671/NQ-UBTVQH15, the one dealing with Lâm Đồng's administrative adjustments.  I have to carefully read through the text, looking for any mention of my old ward, "Xã Hà Lâm" or anything related to "Huyện Đạ Huoai."

At first, I don't see anything directly hitting "Xã Hà Lâm" but there are several mergers of existing wards. Then, boom,  section 34 of 1671/NQ-UBTVQH15 catches my eye. It states  that  "xã Hà Lâm" will be merged into "xã Đạ Huoai 2"! That's it!  Direct hit.

To complete the process, I need to look up "xã Đạ Huoai 2" in my "New wards" list for the relevant details. I construct my final output based on that finding.

citation.header: 1671/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Lâm Đồng
citation.line: 34. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của thị trấn Đạ M'ri và xã Hà Lâm thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Đạ Huoai 2.
